name: Penne alla Vodka
cookingMethod:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 
2. In a separate pan, sauté garlic in olive oil. 
3. Add tomato sauce and vodka, simmer for 10 minutes. 
4. Stir in heavy cream and cook for additional 5 minutes. 
5. Toss cooked pasta with sauce and serve.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
cookingMethod:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. 
2. In a separate pan, cook bacon until crispy. 
3. In a bowl, whisk eggs, parmesan cheese, and black pepper. 
4. Drain pasta and add to the bacon pan. 
5. Turn off the heat and add the egg mixture, stirring quickly to prevent curdling. 
6. Serve immediately.

name: Margherita Pizza
cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 450°F. 
2. Roll out pizza dough and place on a baking sheet. 
3. Spread tomato sauce on top of the dough. 
4. Arrange sliced mozzarella on top of the sauce. 
5. Drizzle olive oil on top of the cheese. 
6. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until crust is crispy. 
7. Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.

name: Lasagna
cookingMethod:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 
2. Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. 
3. In a separate pan, cook ground beef until browned. 
4. Mix ricotta cheese with an egg and parsley. 
5. Spread a layer of tomato sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. 
6. Layer noodles, meat sauce, and ricotta mixture in the dish. 
7. Top with mozzarella cheese. 
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

name: Chicken Parmesan
cookingMethod:
1. Brown chicken thighs in olive oil. 
2. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside. 
3. Sauté onions, garlic, and red bell pepper in the same pan. 
4. Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. 
5. Return chicken to the pan and cook until done. 
6. Serve hot.

name: Tiramisu
cookingMethod:
1. Brew espresso and let cool. 
2. Beat egg yolks and sugar until pale and fluffy. 
3. Fold mascarpone cheese into the egg mixture. 
4. Dip ladyfingers in the cooled espresso and layer in a dish. 
5. Spread mascarpone mixture on top of the ladyfingers. 
6. Repeat layers of ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture. 
7. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Minestrone Soup
cookingMethod:
1. Heat olive oil in a pot. 
2. Add chopped onion, carrots, and celery, and sauté until softened. 
3. Add chopped potatoes and canned tomatoes. 
4. Cover with water and bring to a boil. 
5. Reduce heat and let simmer for 30-40 minutes. 
6. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Cacciatore
cookingMethod:
1. Brown chicken thighs in olive oil. 
2. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside. 
3. Sauté onions, garlic, and red bell pepper in the same pan. 
4. Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. 
5. Return chicken to the pan and cook until done. 
6. Serve hot.

name: Pesto Pasta
cookingMethod:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 
2. In a food processor, blend basil leaves, pine nuts, garlic, and parmesan cheese until smooth. 
3. Toss cooked pasta with the pesto sauce. 
4. Serve hot.

name: Risotto
cookingMethod:
1. Sauté onions in olive oil. 
2. Add arborio rice and toast for 2 minutes. 
3. Add white wine and cook until it evaporates. 
4. Add chicken broth one ladleful at a time, stirring until absorbed. 
5. Repeat until rice is cooked and creamy. 
6. Stir in parmesan cheese. 
7. Serve hot.

name: Caprese Salad
cookingMethod:
1. Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese. 
2. Arrange on a plate, alternating tomato and cheese slices. 
3. Top with basil leaves. 
4. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. 
5. Serve cold.

name: Bolognese Sauce
cookingMethod:
1. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery in olive oil. 
2. Add ground beef and cook until browned. 
3. Add tomato sauce and simmer for 30-40 minutes. 
4. Serve hot over pasta.

name: Bruschetta
cookingMethod:
1. Toast slices of bread. 
2. Rub with garlic. 
3. Top with chopped tomatoes and basil leaves. 
4. Drizzle with olive oil. 
5. Serve hot.

name: Osso Buco
cookingMethod:
1. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery in olive oil. 
2. Brown veal shanks in the same pan. 
3. Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 2-3 hours. 
4. Serve hot over polenta.

name: Linguine with Clam Sauce
cookingMethod:
1. Cook linguine according to package instructions. 
2. Sauté garlic in butter. 
3. Add clams and white wine. 
4. Simmer until clams open. 
5. Toss cooked linguine with the clam sauce. 
6. Serve hot.

name: Gnocchi
cookingMethod:
1. Cook potatoes until tender. 
2. Mash potatoes and let cool. 
3. Add flour, egg, parmesan cheese, and nutmeg. 
4. Mix until a dough forms. 
5. Roll out dough and cut into small pieces. 
6. Boil gnocchi until they float to the surface. 
7. Serve hot with your choice of sauce.

name: Tiramisu
cookingMethod:
1. Dip ladyfingers in espresso. 
2. Layer them in a dish. 
3. Mix mascarpone cheese and sugar. 
4. Spread over the ladyfingers. 
5. Sprinkle with cocoa powder. 
6. Refrigerate for a few hours. 
7. Serve cold.

name: Pesto
cookingMethod:
1. Blend basil leaves, pine nuts, garlic, and parmesan cheese in a food processor. 
2. Slowly add olive oil while blending. 
3. Serve with your choice of pasta.

name: Minestrone Soup
cookingMethod:
1. Sauté carrots, celery, and potatoes in olive oil. 
2. Add cannellini beans and tomato paste. 
3. Simmer for 30-40 minutes. 
4. Serve hot.

name: Fettuccine Alfredo
cookingMethod:
1. Cook fettuccine according to package instructions. 
2. In a separate pan, melt butter and add heavy cream. 
3. Add parmesan cheese and black pepper. 
4. Toss cooked fettuccine with the Alfredo sauce. 
5. Serve hot.
